Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2021.01.24]NuGetGallery of dev into master" (#8392) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "RSS feed has owners concatenated" (#8395) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### For issues regarding the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), file a bug on [NuGet Home](https://github.com/nuget/home/issues).

### Describe the bug
A list of package owners when rendered in RSS reader is concatenated without whitespace:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102933/105768930-ecfcb800-5f11-11eb-8225-298f9718e6b9.png)


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Add https://www.nuget.org/packages/Newtonsoft.Json/atom.xml to your RSS reader
2. Let it sync the feed 
3. Notice `jamesnknewtonsoftdotnetfoundation` in the title.

### Expected behavior
Commas or at least spaces between items is expected.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Cannot connect account with work Microsoft account" (#8394) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi Nuget team!

Can you please assist me with my problem? I'm trying to create an account in Nuget.org and link it with work Microsoft account
Somehow I have created login+password account and now I'm getting this window:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30490978/105715159-4e328480-5f2e-11eb-98bb-aa1a7a80e3d1.png)

I\m understand that is correct behaviour of the site, because login+pass Auth has beem discontinued. When I am trying to log in with Mircosoft after choosing my accnount I'm getting this: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/30490978/105715347-8a65e500-5f2e-11eb-914f-811f0ceb242f.png)

I am expected to be logged in Nuget.org site, but got Need admin approval error. First, I tried to find person in company that related to creating Nuget accounts but no one knows about it inside company. 

I hope that you can help with this problem, 
Thanks
Andrey

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Tracking] refactor of GitHubVulnerabilites2Db requires separate deployment" (#8393) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: As a result of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8356, re-deploy GitHubVulnerabilities2Db as it was touched.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2021.01.24]NuGetGallery of dev into master" (#8392) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed pull request "Show vulnerability alerts on manage packages page" (#8363) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Note: this PR must be merged first: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8362

Addresses remainder of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8361

This change decorates all packages, of which any version is vulnerable, in the manage packages view with a bang and tooltip indicating to go to the details page. This applies to listed and unlisted groups of packages.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14225979/102944030-59e0f480-4505-11eb-8798-915d27807607.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Expand view models for vulnerabilities in manage packages page" (#8362) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Addresses view model portion of https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8361 (I split the PR as best as is practical because it's large-ish). Full description of change to customer experience in PR (view changes) on this issue.

Opened issue "Update PackageRegistrations.HasVulnerableVersion on package version delete" (#8390) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Set PackageRegistrations.HasVulnerableVersion on GitHub data ingress" (#8389) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Add PackageRegistrations.HasVulbnerableVersion" (#8388) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Add field to PackageRegistrations, type bit, name HasVulnerableVersion. Migrate db.

Supports this UX change: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8361

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Add TFM list to package details page in Gallery" (#8387) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Include a list of TFMs in package details page, supported by updated TFM logic

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Replace TM logic in Gallery package service" (#8386) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Replace the logic that populates this field with a nupkg lib folders-based approach. This will give us a mostly-accurate quick win on displaying TFMs supported by a package.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Stats]Enable Alternate storage for downloads.v1.json" (#8380) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Enables (behind a feature flag) support for allowing an alternate location for downloads.v1.json source.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GetInstalledPackages throws for PackageReference projects when assets file doesn't match project TFMs" (#10081) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Introduce a new msbuild property to exclude build output for specific tfms during pack task" (#10396) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget currently provides a msbuild called IncludeBuildOutput to disable including the build output for all tfms. 
Nuget provides this kind of feature for other targets like ```_GetFrameworksWithSuppressedDependencies``` which run during the pack command.
It will enable the scenario where developer wants to exclude a certain kind of build output for a specific tfm.

cc @ViktorHofer @nkolev92 @ericstj @safern

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Introduce a new msbuild property to exclude build output for specific tfms during pack task" (#10396) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Nuget currently provides a msbuild called IncludeBuildOutput to disable including the build output for all tfms. 
Nuget provides this kind of feature for other targets like ```_GetFrameworksWithSuppressedDependencies``` which run during the pack command.
It will enable the scenario where developer wants to exclude a certain kind of build output for a specific tfm.

cc @ViktorHofer @nkolev92 @ericstj @safern

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "November dry run for custom V2 OData query deprecation" (#48) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (https://github.com/NuGet/Announcements/issues/37) last year and we will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in **February 2021**. 

We will conduct **a dry run of the OData deprecation** to ensure that there are no surprises for users, which is scheduled to ensure overlap with normal working hours across the globe. The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	· **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**  – 48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
 
Refer to the table below to identify the test slot time in your time zone.
	· UTC-9 to UTC-2 – [Green test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Green+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3923&ah=4)
	· UTC-1 to UTC+6 – [Yellow test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Yellow+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3915&ah=4)
	· UTC+7 to UTC-10 – [Blue test slot](https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?msg=NuGet.org+OData+deprecation+test+-+Blue+slot&iso=20201111T07&p1=3909&ah=4)

The goal is to help you identify systems that may be affected and will give you an opportunity to take action before we permanently remove support for select v2 endpoints.
 
There will be two stages in the brown-out to accommodate a variety of usage scenarios. During these times, we will be heavily monitoring social media and other communication channels to address questions and concerns. 
	· **Nov. 11, 2020** – 3 time slots in a 24 hour period, for 4 hours each
	· **Nov. 17 & 18, 2020**  – 48 hours

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423).
